title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace in C", 1690–1714
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray-blue wash on white laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Richly decorated arcade leading to large staircase. Barrel vault supported on the right side by caryatids and on the left by twisted columns. composition situated in large billowing clouds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace in C", 1690–1714.
1690–1714. Pen and black ink, brush and gray-blue wash on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-24.
